Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Reverend Dr Kirk Patrick Cohall, Lenox Road Baptist Church
located at 1356 Nostrand Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11226.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Joseph.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Reverend Dr Kirk Patrick Cohall, Lenox Road Baptist Church
located at 1356 Nostrand Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11226.

Council Member Joseph moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 25, 2023 be adopted as printed by Council Member Restler.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Restler moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 25, 2022 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Items.AgendaNote: MESSAGES & PAPERS FROM THE MAYOR - None

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Items.AgendaNote: COMMUNICATIONS FROM CITY, COUNTY & BOROUGH OFFICES - None

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups
Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution calling upon the United States Congress and President to end the Cuban embargo and Cuban travel ban and to remove Cuba from the State Sponsors of Terrorism list due to the unjust harm it causes to the Cuban people.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 7 Council Members formally noted their intention to vote negative against this item:
Council Members Ariola, Carr, Gennaro, Holden, Kagan, Yeger and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

The following Council Member formally noted her intention to abstained from voting on this item:  
Council Member  CM Mealy.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Congress and President to end the Cuban embargo and Cuban travel ban and to remove Cuba from the State Sponsors of Terrorism list due to the unjust harm it causes to the Cuban people.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring June Caribbean Heritage Month.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Declaring June Caribbean Heritage Month.

Items.Title: Resolution designating May 21 annually as Christopher “Biggie Smalls” Wallace Day in the City of New York and recognizing his contributions to the cultural landscape of his home borough of Brooklyn and to Hip Hop worldwide.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Designating May 21 annually as Christopher “Biggie Smalls” Wallace Day in the City of New York.

Items.Title: Resolution designating July 8 annually as Reggie “Combat Jack” Ossé Day in the City of New York and honoring his multifaceted contributions to the Hip Hop industry as a lawyer, executive, editor, and podcaster.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Member formally noted his intention to abstain from voting on this item: 
Council Member Ossé.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Designating July 8 annually as Reggie “Combat Jack” Ossé Day in the City of New York and honoring his multifaceted contributions to the Hip Hop industry as a lawyer, executive, editor, and podcaster.

Items.Title: Resolution designating June as Fatherhood Recognition Month annually in the City of New York to honor and support the contributions of fathers to family and community life.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Designating June as Fatherhood Recognition Month.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to pass and the President to sign legislation in relation to increasing the supply and affordability of certain housing and to adjust the calculations of area median income for purposes of Federal low-income housing assistance, and for other purposes.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 4 Council Members formally noted their intention to vote negative against this item:
Council Members Ariola, Carr, Holden and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the supply and affordability of certain housing and to adjust the calculations of area median income for purposes of Federal low-income housing assistance, and for other purposes.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Items.AgendaNote: REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON MENTAL HEALTH, DISABILITIES AND ADDICTION

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign legislation to fully repeal the Institutions for Mental Diseases Exclusion from the Social Security Act to allow states to use federal Medicaid funding to provide mental health and substance use disorder treatment services to adult Medicaid beneficiaries at Institutions for Mental Diseases.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sign legislation to fully repeal the Institutions for Mental Diseases Exclusion from the Social Security Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the office of community mental health to maintain access to an online services database
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on General Orders
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the office of community mental health to maintain access to an online services database.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Federal Government to ensure that calls to the 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline program are routed based on geolocation rather than area code.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Mental Health Roadmap Legislative Package - Ensure that calls to the 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline program are routed based on geolocation rather than area code.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on New York State to subsidize the education and licensing costs of CUNY students who commit to working in the public sector in the mental health professions, which historically experience high turnover rates and staffing shortages.

Items.MatterName: Mental Health Roadmap Legislative Package - NYS Office of Mental Health to expand enforcement of mental health and substance use disorder insurance parity and apply for federal grants to enforce insurance parity.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State and Federal governments to expand the availability of mental health professionals for low and moderate income New Yorkers by increasing Medicaid reimbursement rates for behavioral health services.

Items.MatterName: Mental Health Roadmap Legislative Package - Expand the availability of mental health professionals for low and moderate income New Yorkers by increasing Medicaid reimbursement rates for behavioral health services.

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Mental Health Roadmap Legislative Package - Collaborate closely with New York City to achieve their shared goal of developing 35,000 units of supportive housing.

Items.MinutesNote: Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) recessed these proceedings subject to call.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers).

There were 49 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.
The Majority Leader (Council Member Powers) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 561-B,  VOTE: 42-6-1
Negative: Council Members Ariola, Carr, Holden, Kagan, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli);
Abstain: Council Member Velasquez.

Int . No. 1001-B,  VOTE: 48-0-1
Abstention: Council Member Steven.

Preconsidered Int. No. 1102-A,  VOTE: 47-0-2
Abstention: Council Members Ossé and Yeger.

Res. No. 88,  VOTE: 
Negative: Council Member Nurse and Richardson Jordan;
Abstentions: Council Member  Aviles, Cabán, De La Rosa, Gutierrez, Hanif, Ossé, and Restler.

Res. No. 588-A,  VOTE: 48-0-1
Abstention: Council Member Velasquez.

Preconsidered Res. No. 690;  
Preconsidered Res. No. 691;   
Preconsidered Res. No. 692;

VOTE: 47-2-0
Negative: Council Members Barron and Yeger.
